data.question: What is the highest ethylene/ethane selectivity achieved by Fe2(m-dobdc) under relevant conditions?
Which metal variant of M2(m-dobdc) frameworks shows the highest propylene/propane selectivity?
Is the adsorption of ethylene in Fe2(m-dobdc) reversible under mild regeneration conditions?
What is the role of increased charge density at the metal site in M2(m-dobdc) frameworks?
data.answer: It leads to enhanced metal-olefin interactions and increased olefin/paraffin selectivity.

data.question: Does the M2(m-dobdc) framework require a temperature swing for olefin/paraffin separation?
What is the significance of the differential enthalpy calculations in the context of olefin/paraffin separation?
data.answer: They help understand the thermodynamics of gas molecules interacting within the system, indicating the strength of olefin adsorption relative to paraffins.

data.question: Which metal variant of M2(m-dobdc) has the highest ethylene adsorption enthalpy at a loading of 1 mmol/g?
Can the M2(m-dobdc) frameworks achieve polymer grade purity (>99.9%) for olefins?
How does the adsorption kinetics of olefins in Fe2(m-dobdc) compare to adsorbents relying on size-exclusion mechanisms?
data.answer: Fe2(m-dobdc) exhibits rapid adsorption kinetics, reaching >90% of equilibrium in less than 30 s, which is faster than size-exclusion based adsorbents.

data.question: What is the effect of substituting the metal in M2(dobdc) frameworks on olefin/paraffin selectivity?
data.answer: Substituting the metal affects the charge density at the metal site, which in turn influences the olefin/paraffin selectivity, with Fe2(m-dobdc) showing the highest selectivity.

data.question: Is the adsorption of propylene in Fe2(m-dobdc) faster than the adsorption of propane?
What is the role of coordinatively unsaturated M2+ sites in M2(m-dobdc) frameworks?
data.answer: They lead to superior performance for the physisorptive separation of ethylene from ethane and propylene from propane due to enhanced metal-olefin interactions.

data.question: Does the synthesis method of M2(m-dobdc) materials involve the use of methanol and DMF?
What is the yield of Co2(m-dobdc) and Ni2(m-dobdc) after synthesis according to the provided method?
How does the selectivity of M2(m-dobdc) frameworks for olefin/paraffin separations compare to their para-functionalized counterparts?
data.answer: M2(m-dobdc) frameworks exhibit significantly higher selectivity for olefin/paraffin separations than their para-functionalized counterparts.

data.question: What is the effect of temperature on the IAST selectivity of M2(m-dobdc) frameworks?
data.answer: Temperature-dependent IAST calculations predict more dramatic differences in selectivity at lower temperatures, with higher selectivity expected at reduced temperatures.

data.question: Can M2(m-dobdc) frameworks produce high purity olefins without a temperature swing?
What is the significance of transient adsorption experiments in evaluating M2(m-dobdc) frameworks?
data.answer: They show fast kinetics of ethylene adsorption, indicating that these frameworks can be used in pressure-swing adsorption processes with fast cycle times.

data.question: What is the role of the metal variant in determining the adsorption enthalpy of olefins in M2(m-dobdc) frameworks?
data.answer: The metal variant affects the charge density and backbonding character at the metal site, influencing the adsorption enthalpy of olefins and thus the selectivity.

data.question: Is the adsorption capacity of olefins in M2(m-dobdc) frameworks influenced by the metal variant?
